articles.title: Webb detects extremely small main-belt asteroid - Phys.org
articles.description: A previously unknown 100-to-200-meter asteroid—roughly the size of Rome's Colosseum—has been detected by an international team of European astronomers using the NASA/ESA/CSA James Webb Space Telescope. Their project used data from the calibration of the Mid-I…

articles.author: Hannah Ward-Glenton, Holly Ellyatt
articles.title: European markets close lower as investors gauge economic outlook - CNBC
articles.description: European markets were lower at the start of the new trading week as investors gauge the global economic outlook and efforts to tackle inflation.
articles.content:
Euro zone bond yields rose Monday as traders took on board recent comments from the European Central Bank and what it means for the rate hiking cycle.

articles.title: Russia's Sechin says Europe no longer sets Urals price - Reuters.com
articles.description: Europe will no longer set the reference price for Russia's flagship Urals crude, Igor Sechin, the CEO of Russia's oil major Rosneft said on Monday, now Asia has emerged at the largest buyer of Russian oil since the West placed it under sanctions.

articles.author: Paul Best
articles.title: Europe bans Russian diesel imports and other refined oil products - Fox Business
articles.description: Europe's ban on Russian diesel imports and other refined petroleum products went into effect on Sunday, the latest attempt by the 27-nation bloc to defund Putin's war machine.
